sys:positions.title: Minister for Labour and Transport Management

sys:positions.organization: National Integrated Study and Research Centre of Nepal
sys:positions.title: Chief Adviser

description: Kamal Prasad Chaulagain is a Nepalese politician who was elected to parliament in 1991 with the Samyukta Janamorcha Nepal. He has been involved with several political parties, including the Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist) which he joined in 1995, the break-away Communist Party of Nepal (Marxist-Leninist) in 1998 where he was a Central Committee member, and rejoining the CPN(UML) in 2002. After resigning from CPN(UML) on November 8, 2002, he was appointed Minister for Labour and Transport Management and Minister for Population and Environment in the cabinet led by Lokendra Bahadur Chand. He is also the Chief Adviser of the National Integrated Study and Research Centre of Nepal.
short_description: Nepalese politician, former government minister, and member of parliament.
